TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit TaskScheduler extends System.Object

summary.span: 表示一个处理将任务排队到线程中的低级工作的对象。

span.span: Represents an object that handles the low-level work of queuing tasks onto threads.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 实例类表示任务计划程序。An instance of the class represents a task scheduler. 任务计划程序确保最终执行任务作业。A task scheduler ensures that the work of a task is eventually executed. 默认的任务计划程序基于 .NET Framework 4 线程池，提供工作窃取实现负载平衡、线程注入/退出以实现最大吞吐量，并提供整体卓越性能。The default task scheduler is based on the .NET Framework 4 thread pool, which provides work-stealing for load-balancing, thread injection/retirement for maximum throughput, and overall good performance. 它应足以满足大多数方案。It should be sufficient for most scenarios. 类也用作所有可自定义计划逻辑的扩展点。The class also serves as the extension point for all customizable scheduling logic. 这包括机制，如应该向调试器公开如何安排执行的任务和如何计划的任务。This includes mechanisms such as how to schedule a task for execution, and how scheduled tasks should be exposed to debuggers. 如果需要特殊功能，可以创建自定义计划程序并启用对特定任务或查询。If you require special functionality, you can create a custom scheduler and enable it for specific tasks or queries. 本主题内容：In this topic: [默认任务计划程序和线程池The default task scheduler and the thread pool](#Default) [全局队列与本地队列The global queue vs. local queues](#Queues) [工作窃取Work stealing](#Stealing) [长时间运行的任务Long-running tasks](#LongRunning) [任务内联Task inlining](#Inlining) [指定同步上下文Specifying a synchronization context](#Sync) ## 默认任务计划程序和线程池The default task scheduler and the thread pool 任务并行库和 PLINQ 的默认计划程序使用.NET Framework 线程池，由表示类进行排队并执行工作。The default scheduler for the Task Parallel Library and PLINQ uses the .NET Framework thread pool, which is represented by the class, to queue and execute work. 线程池会使用提供的信息类型来有效地支持并行任务和查询通常表示的细化并行 （生存期较短的工作单位）。The thread pool uses the information that is provided by the type to efficiently support the fine-grained parallelism (short-lived units of work) that parallel tasks and queries often represent. ### 全局队列与本地队列The global queue vs. local queues 线程池维护全局先进先出 （先入先出） 工作队列中的每个应用程序域中的线程。The thread pool maintains a global FIFO (first-in, first-out) work queue for threads in each application domain. 每当程序调用(或) 方法，工作是放置在此共享队列上并最终取消排队到下一个可用线程上。Whenever a program calls the (or ) method, the work is put on this shared queue and eventually de-queued onto the next thread that becomes available. 从.NET Framework 4 开始，此队列有了改进，可使用类似于无锁算法类。Starting with the .NET Framework 4, this queue has been improved to use a lock-free algorithm that resembles the class. 通过使用此无锁实现，线程池会花费更少时间排队和离队工作项时。By using this lock-free implementation, the thread pool spends less time when it queues and de-queues work items. 此性能优势可供使用的线程池的所有程序。This performance benefit is available to all programs that use the thread pool. 最高级任务（即不在其他任务的上下文中创建的任务）与任何其他工作项一样放在全局队列上。Top-level tasks, which are tasks that are not created in the context of another task, are put on the global queue just like any other work item. 但是，嵌套任务或子任务（在其他任务的上下文中创建）的处理方式大不相同。However, nested or child tasks, which are created in the context of another task, are handled quite differently. 子任务或嵌套任务放置在特定于执行父任务的线程的本地队列上。A child or nested task is put on a local queue that is specific to the thread on which the parent task is executing. 父任务可能是最高级任务，也可能是其他任务的子任务。The parent task may be a top-level task or it also may be the child of another task. 当此线程准备好执行更多工作时，首先查看本地队列。When this thread is ready for more work, it first looks in the local queue. 如果工作项在此处等待，即可快速访问它们。If work items are waiting there, they can be accessed quickly. 后进先出顺序 (LIFO) 以保留缓存区域并减少争用中访问的本地队列。The local queues are accessed in last-in, first-out order (LIFO) to preserve cache locality and reduce contention. 有关子任务和嵌套的任务的详细信息，请参阅[附加和分离的子任务](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/attached-and-detached-child-tasks.md)。For more information about child tasks and nested tasks, see [Attached and Detached Child Tasks](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/attached-and-detached-child-tasks.md). 使用本地队列不仅可减少全局队列上的压力，而且还会利用数据局部性。The use of local queues not only reduces pressure on the global queue, but also takes advantage of data locality. 本地中的工作项排入队列经常在物理上是相互在内存中的引用数据结构。Work items in the local queue frequently reference data structures that are physically near one another in memory. 在这些情况下，数据已在缓存中之后的第一个任务已运行，并且可以快速访问。In these cases, the data is already in the cache after the first task has run and can be accessed quickly. 这两[并行 LINQ (PLINQ)](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/parallel-linq-plinq.md)和广泛，类使用嵌套任务和子任务，并通过使用本地工作队列实现显著的加速。Both [Parallel LINQ (PLINQ)](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/parallel-linq-plinq.md) and the class use nested tasks and child tasks extensively, and achieve significant speedups by using the local work queues. ### 工作窃取Work stealing 从.NET Framework 4 开始，线程池还提供工作窃取算法，以帮助确保没有线程处于空闲状态时其他人仍具有在各自队列中工作。Starting with the .NET Framework 4, the thread pool also features a work-stealing algorithm to help make sure that no threads are sitting idle while others still have work in their queues. 当线程池线程准备好执更多工作时，首先查看其本地队列的开头，再查看全局队列，然后查看其他线程的本地队列。When a thread-pool thread is ready for more work, it first looks at the head of its local queue, then in the global queue, and then in the local queues of other threads. 如果在其他线程的本地队列中找到工作项，它会先应用试探法以确保可有效运行工作。If it finds a work item in the local queue of another thread, it first applies heuristics to make sure that it can run the work efficiently. 如果可以但它取消队列的工作项的结尾 （按 FIFO 顺序）。If it can, it de-queues the work item from the tail (in FIFO order). 这样可以减少每个本地队列上的争用并保留数据位置。This reduces contention on each local queue and preserves data locality. 此体系结构有助于线程池进行负载平衡不是以前的版本更有效地工作。This architecture helps the thread pool load-balance work more efficiently than past versions did. ### 长时间运行的任务Long-running tasks 可能想要显式防止将任务放到本地队列上。You may want to explicitly prevent a task from being put on a local queue. 例如，你可能知道特定工作项将运行相对长的时间并可能阻塞本地队列中的所有其他工作项。For example, you may know that a particular work item will run for a relatively long time and is likely to block all other work items on the local queue. 在这种情况下，可指定 选项，它提示附加线程执行任务时可能需要计划程序，以使此任务不阻塞本地队列中其他线程或工作项的向前推动。In this case, you can specify the option, which provides a hint to the scheduler that an additional thread might be required for the task so that it does not block the forward progress of other threads or work items on the local queue. 通过使用此选项可以避免线程池完全，包括全局和本地队列。By using this option you avoid the thread pool completely, including the global and local queues. ### 任务内联Task inlining 在某些情况下当处于等待状态，它可能是以同步方式执行上执行等待操作的线程。In some cases when a is waited on, it may be executed synchronously on the thread that is performing the wait operation. 这可提高性能，从而无需进行其他线程，而使用现有的线程，否则被阻塞的。This enhances performance by preventing the need for an additional thread and instead using the existing thread, which would have blocked otherwise. 若要防止由于可重入性导致的错误，任务内联时才出现在相关线程的本地队列中找到等待目标。To prevent errors due to reentrancy, task inlining only occurs when the wait target is found in the relevant thread's local queue. ## 指定同步上下文Specifying a synchronization context 可使用 方法指定任务应计划在特定线程上运行。You can use the method to specify that a task should be scheduled to run on a particular thread. 在 Windows 窗体和 Windows Presentation Foundation 等框架中此操作非常有用，在此类框架中对用户界面对象的访问限制为只可访问在创建 UI 对象的同一线程上运行的代码。This is useful in frameworks such as Windows Forms and Windows Presentation Foundation where access to user interface objects is often restricted to code that is running on the same thread on which the UI object was created. 下面的示例使用用于计划的任务，在创建用户界面 (UI) 控件所在的同一线程上的 Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) 应用中的方法。The following example uses the method in a Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) app to schedule a task on the same thread that the user interface (UI) control was created on. 该示例创建马赛克从指定的目录中随机选择的映像。The example creates a mosaic of images that are randomly selected from a specified directory. WPF 对象用于加载和重设图像大小。The WPF objects are used to load and resize the images. 原始像素然后传递给一个任务，使用循环，以向大型的单字节数组写入像素数据。The raw pixels are then passed to a task that uses a loop to write the pixel data into a large single-byte array. 因为没有两个磁贴占用相同的数组元素不需要进行同步。No synchronization is required because no two tiles occupy the same array elements. 因为独立于任何其他磁贴计算其位置，则还可以按任意顺序写入磁贴。The tiles can also be written in any order because their position is calculated independently of any other tile. 大型数组然后传递到其中的像素数据加载到图像控件在 UI 线程运行的任务。The large array is then passed to a task that runs on the UI thread, where the pixel data is loaded into an Image control. 该示例将数据从 UI 线程、 通过使用并行循环对其进行修改和对象，它们然后将其传递回 UI 线程运行的任务。The example moves data off the UI thread, modifies it by using parallel loops and objects, and then passes it back to a task that runs on the UI thread. 当您必须使用任务并行库执行操作由 WPF API 不支持或不足够快的速度时，此方法非常有用。This approach is useful when you have to use the Task Parallel Library to perform operations that either are not supported by the WPF API, or are not sufficiently fast. 在 WPF 中创建映像马赛克另一种方法是使用控件并将图像添加到它。Another way to create an image mosaic in WPF is to use a control and add images to it. 负责处理定位磁贴。The handles the work of positioning the tiles. 但是，仅可以在 UI 线程上执行这项工作。However, this work can only be performed on the UI thread. [!code-csharp[TPL_SyncContext#01](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Misc/tpl_synccontext/cs/mainwindow.xaml.cs#01)] [!code-vb[TPL_SyncContext#01](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Misc/tpl_synccontext/vb/MainWindow.xaml.vb#01)] 若要创建示例中，在 Visual Studio 中创建一个 WPF 应用程序项目并将其命名 WPF_CS1 (对于C#的 WPF 项目) 或 WPF_VB1 （适用于 Visual Basic WPF 项目）。To create the example, create a WPF application project in Visual Studio and name it WPF_CS1 (for a C# WPF project) or WPF_VB1 (for a Visual Basic WPF project). 然后执行以下操作：Then do the following: 1. 在设计视图中拖动控件从**工具箱**拖到设计图面的左上角。In design view, drag an control from the **Toolbox** onto the upper left corner of the design surface. 在中**名称**文本框中的**属性**窗口中，命名控件"映像"。In the **Name** textbox of the **Properties** window, name the control "image". 2. 拖动控件从**工具箱**到应用程序窗口的左下角。Drag a control from the **Toolbox** to the lower left part of the application window. 在 XAML 视图中，指定作为"Make 马赛克"按钮的属性，并指定其属性设置为"100"。In XAML view, specify the property of the button as "Make a mosaic", and specify its property as "100". 连接具有事件`button_Click`通过添加在该示例的代码中定义的事件处理程序`Click="button_Click"`到`

span.span: All members of the abstract type are thread-safe and may be used from multiple threads concurrently.

span.span: The to be queued.

summary.span: 将 排队到计划程序中。

span.span: Queues a to the scheduler.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个类派生自实现此方法以接受在计划程序上安排的任务。A class derived from implements this method to accept tasks being scheduled on the scheduler. 一个典型的实现就将任务存储在内部数据结构中，这将会在将来的某个时间执行这些任务的线程由提供服务。A typical implementation would store the task in an internal data structure, which would be serviced by threads that would execute those tasks at some time in the future. 此方法仅用来调用由.NET Framework 并不应直接由派生类调用。This method is only meant to be called by the .NET Framework and should not be called directly by the derived class. 这是必要的维护系统的一致性。This is necessary for maintaining the consistency of the system.

span.span: The argument is null.

span.span: The to be dequeued.

summary.span: 尝试将以前排队到此计划程序中的 取消排队。

span.span: Attempts to dequeue a that was previously queued to this scheduler.

returns.span: 一个布尔值，该值指示是否已成功地将 参数取消排队。

span.span: A Boolean denoting whether the argument was successfully dequeued.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 有关更多信息，请参见。For more information, see . 此方法中可能会执行 finally 块;因此它应返回尽可能快地因此使任何资源，如对象可以及时地释放。This method may execute in a finally block; therefore it should return as quickly as possible so that any resources such as objects can be disposed of in a timely manner.

span.span: The argument is null.
Task Parallel Library (TPL)

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance bool TryExecuteTask(class System.Threading.Tasks.Task task) cil managed

span.span: A object to be executed.

summary.span: 尝试在此计划程序上执行提供的 。

span.span: Attempts to execute the provided on this scheduler.

returns.span: 一个布尔值，如果成功执行了 ，则该值为 true；如果未成功执行，则该值为 false。

span.span: A Boolean that is true if was successfully executed, false if it was not.

returns.span: 执行失败的常见原因是，该任务先前已经执行或者位于正在由另一个线程执行的进程中。

span.span: A common reason for execution failure is that the task had previously been executed or is in the process of being executed by another thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 计划程序实现随附实例，以通过执行方法或方法。Scheduler implementations are provided with instances to be executed through either the method or the method. 当计划程序被视为不适合运行提供的任务，应该用于执行此操作。When the scheduler deems it appropriate to run the provided task, should be used to do so. TryExecuteTask 处理执行的任务，包括操作调用、 异常处理、 状态管理和生命周期控制的所有方面。TryExecuteTask handles all aspects of executing a task, including action invocation, exception handling, state management, and lifecycle control. 必须仅用于.NET Framework 基础结构提供给此计划程序任务。 must only be used for tasks provided to this scheduler by the .NET Framework infrastructure. 不应该用于执行任意任务通过自定义机制而获得。It should not be used to execute arbitrary tasks obtained through custom mechanisms.

span.span: The is not associated with this scheduler.
Task Parallel Library (TPL)

MemberSignature.Value: protected abstract bool TryExecuteTaskInline (System.Threading.Tasks.Task task, bool taskWasPreviouslyQueued);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool TryExecuteTaskInline(class System.Threading.Tasks.Task task, bool taskWasPreviouslyQueued) cil managed
protected: abstract bool TryExecuteTaskInline(System::Threading::Tasks::Task ^ task, bool taskWasPreviouslyQueued);
abstract member TryExecuteTaskInline : System.Threading.Tasks.Task * bool -> bool

span.span: The to be executed.

param.name: taskWasPreviouslyQueued
param.span: 一个布尔值，该值指示任务之前是否已排队。

span.span: A Boolean denoting whether or not task has previously been queued.

param.span: 如果此参数为 True，则该任务以前可能已排队（已计划）；如果为 False，则已知该任务尚未排队，此时将执行此调用，以便以内联方式执行该任务，而不用将其排队。

span.span: If this parameter is True, then the task may have been previously queued (scheduled); if False, then the task is known not to have been queued, and this call is being made in order to execute the task inline without queuing it.

summary.span: 确定是否可以在此调用中同步执行提供的 ，如果可以，将执行该任务。

span.span: Determines whether the provided can be executed synchronously in this call, and if it can, executes it.

returns.span: 一个布尔值，该值指示是否已以内联方式执行该任务。

span.span: A Boolean value indicating whether the task was executed inline.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个类派生自实现此函数，以便启动该任务对象上的等待的线程上支持内联执行的任务。A class derived from implements this function to support inline execution of a task on a thread that initiates a wait on that task object. 内联执行是可选的并可能拒绝该请求返回 false。Inline execution is optional, and the request may be rejected by returning false. 但是，更多的任务可以进行内联、 更好的计划程序将进行缩放。However, the more tasks that can be inlined, the better the scheduler will scale. 事实上，计划程序的内嵌元素过少可能容易出现死锁。In fact, a scheduler that inlines too little may be prone to deadlocks. 正确实现应确保下保证由计划程序的策略执行的请求可以成功内联。A proper implementation should ensure that a request executing under the policies guaranteed by the scheduler can successfully inline. 例如，如果计划程序使用的专用的线程执行任务，该线程的任何内联请求应会成功。For example, if a scheduler uses a dedicated thread to execute tasks, any inlining requests from that thread should succeed. 如果计划程序决定执行内联执行，它应执行操作来调用基 TaskScheduler与提供的任务对象，传播的返回值的方法。If a scheduler decides to perform the inline execution, it should do so by calling to the base TaskScheduler's method with the provided task object, propagating the return value. 它还可能适用于计划程序若要从其内部数据结构中删除内联的任务，如果决定接受内联的请求。It may also be appropriate for the scheduler to remove an inlined task from its internal data structures if it decides to honor the inlining request. 但请注意，在某些情况下一个计划程序可能要求内联以前未提供与它通信的任务方法。Note, however, that under some circumstances a scheduler may be asked to inline a task that was not previously provided to it with the method. 派生的计划程序负责确保调用线程是适用于执行指定的任务，就其自身的计划和执行策略相关。The derived scheduler is responsible for making sure that the calling thread is suitable for executing the given task as far as its own scheduling and execution policies are concerned. 有关更多信息，请参见。For more information, see .

span.span: The argument is null.
The was already executed.
Task Parallel Library (TPL)

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Custom Event UnobservedTaskException As EventHandler(Of UnobservedTaskExceptionEventArgs)

summary.span: 出错的任务中未观察到的异常将触发异常呈报策略时出现，默认情况下会终止进程。

span.span: Occurs when a faulted task's unobserved exception is about to trigger exception escalation policy, which, by default, would terminate the process.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此应用程序的全域性事件触发提供一种机制来防止异常升级策略 （其中，默认情况下终止进程）。This application domain-wide event provides a mechanism to prevent exception escalation policy (which, by default, terminates the process) from triggering. 为了简化开发人员能够编写基于任务的异步代码[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]更改未观察到异常的默认异常行为。To make it easier for developers to write asynchronous code based on tasks, the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] changes the default exception behavior for unobserved exceptions. 尽管仍未观察到的异常引发异常，该过程不会终止默认情况下。Although unobserved exceptions still raise the exception, the process does not terminate by default. 相反，异常处理由运行时后引发该事件，而不考虑是否将事件处理程序观察异常。Instead, the exception is handled by the runtime after the event is raised, regardless of whether an event handler observes the exception. 可以配置该行为。This behavior can be configured. 从开始[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]，可以使用[ `` ](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/throwunobservedtaskexceptions-element.md)要恢复到的行为配置元素[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]并终止此过程：Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)], you can use the [``](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/throwunobservedtaskexceptions-element.md) configuration element to revert to the behavior of the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] and terminate the process: ```xml ```

span.span: Task Parallel Library (TPL)
<ThrowUnobservedTaskExceptions> Element
